title: Scotty
description: Scotty is a WebSocket-enabled PDF viewer, allowing multiple clients to look at and browse through a document together in real time.

title: conveyor
description: A conveyor belt-like microservice for converting PDFs into images and uploading to an S3 bucket.

title: Doodler
description: Doodler is a simple multi-window drawing app built with React, TypeScript, and the [Gambar](https://github.com/jtanadi/gambar) library.

title: Gambar
description: Gambar is a small drawing library written in Typescript. The library provides a thin, consistent, layer on top of some basic Canvas API methods. Gambar doesn't aim to be comprehensive, but rather, to provide convenience when implementing a drawing app with limited scope.

title: zipline
description: zipline is a lightweight microservice to download files from GitHub. The service streams files into a `.zip` archive and provides users with a downloadable file.

title: peekachu
description: peekachu is a RESTful microservice that gathers all visible directories and files of a repo and returns their names. The service works with GitHub webhooks to fetch the latest commit of a repo and uses an in-memory cache for faster lookup.

title: JSBattle
description: JSBattle is a multiplayer game where players compete against each other by completing  coding challenges in real time. As the primary contributor, I laid out the app's architecture and implemented most front- and back-end components.

title: Capsule
description: Capsule is an e-commerce store for Silicon Valley-related products. I worked on vertical slices of the project, implementing primary data models, API endpoints, and major frontend components.

title: CheckParallelTool
description: CheckParallelTool is a [RoboFont](https://robofont.com) plugin that helps type designers draw smoother and more balanced b√©zier curves. This project was written in Python 3.2 using the RoboFont / mojo / vanilla API. CheckParallelTool is available on RoboFont through [RoboFont Mechanic](https://robofontmechanic.com/).

title: Etch-a-Sketch
description: Etch-a-Sketch is a [RoboFont](https://robofont.com) plugin to preview, print, and sketch work-in-progress typeface designs. Written in Python 2.6 using the RoboFont / mojo / vanilla API.

title: Samples+Parallels
description: An work-in-progress interactive website for a book club and a book and an exercise in writing everything from scratch. S+P uses no libraries and all components were written in vanilla JavaScript; all content is written as `.txt` files and fetched by the client. The site uses the [Sunrise Sunset API](https://sunrise-sunset.org/) to determine the time of day based on the user's IP address.

title: Cork
description: Cork is a work-in-progress bulletin board app.

title: Tableaux
description: Tableaux is a work-in-progress CLI single-page static page generator used to sort and display graphic panels and their specs. The tool was built in place of issuing & re-issuing design guidelines as projects mature and specifications change. A config file is used to create dropdown filters and display information related to each panel.

title: PatternPreview
description: A lightweight [RoboFont](https://robofont.com) tool to help with drawing repeating patterns.

title: Algorithms & Data Structures
description: A collection of algorithms & data structures implemented in JavaScript/TypeScript and Python.
